member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBinary.IndexName

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBinary.Compress

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchBoolean.Index
member.summary: index Set to no if the value should not be indexed. Setting to no disables include_in_all. If set to no the field should be either stored in _source, have include_in_all enabled, or store be set to true for this to be useful.

member.summary: null_value When there is a (JSON) null value for the field, use the null_value as the field value. Defaults to not adding the field at all.

member.summary: store Set to true to actually store the field in the index, false to not store it. Defaults to false (note, the JSON document itself is stored, and it can be retrieved from it).

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.Index
member.summary: index Set to analyzed for the field to be indexed and searchable after being broken down into token using an analyzer. not_analyzed means that its still searchable, but does not go through any analysis process or broken down into tokens. no means that it won’t be searchable at all (as an individual field; it may still be included in _all). Setting to no disables include_in_all. Defaults to analyzed.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.DocValues
member.summary: doc_values Set to true to store field values in a column-stride fashion. Automatically set to true when the fielddata format is doc_values.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.TermVector
member.summary: term_vector Possible values are no, yes, with_offsets, with_positions, with_positions_offsets. Defaults to no.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.Boost
member.summary: boost The boost value. Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.NullValue
member.summary: null_value When there is a (JSON) null value for the field, use the null_value as the field value. Defaults to not adding the field at all.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.NormsEnabled
member.summary: norms: {enabled: value} Boolean value if norms should be enabled or not. Defaults to true for analyzed fields, and to false for not_analyzed fields. See the section about norms.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.NormsLoading
member.summary: norms: {loading: value} Describes how norms should be loaded, possible values are eager and lazy (default). It is possible to change the default value to eager for all fields by configuring the index setting index.norms.loading to eager.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.IndexOptions
member.summary: index_options Allows to set the indexing options, possible values are docs (only doc numbers are indexed), freqs (doc numbers and term frequencies), and positions (doc numbers, term frequencies and positions). Defaults to positions for analyzed fields, and to docs for not_analyzed fields. It is also possible to set it to offsets (doc numbers, term frequencies, positions and offsets).

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.Analyzer
member.summary: analyzer The analyzer used to analyze the text contents when analyzed during indexing and when searching using a query string. Defaults to the globally configured analyzer.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.IndexAnalyzer
member.summary: index_analyzer The analyzer used to analyze the text contents when analyzed during indexing.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.SearchAnalyzer
member.summary: search_analyzer The analyzer used to analyze the field when part of a query string. Can be updated on an existing field.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.IncludeInAll
member.summary: include_in_all Should the field be included in the _all field (if enabled). If index is set to no this defaults to false, otherwise, defaults to true or to the parent object type setting.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.IgnoreAbove
member.summary: ignore_above The analyzer will ignore strings larger than this size. Useful for generic not_analyzed fields that should ignore long text.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.CoreTypeAttributes.ElasticsearchString.PositionOffsetGap
member.summary: position_offset_gap Position increment gap between field instances with the same field name. Defaults to 0.

P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.NumberOfReplicas
member.summary: index.number_of_replicas The number of replicas each shard has.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.RefreshInterval
member.summary: index.refresh_interval The async refresh interval of a shard. ----- bulk Indexing Usage For example, the update settings API can be used to dynamically change the index from being more performant for bulk indexing, and then move it to more real time indexing state. Before the bulk indexing is started, use: "refresh_interval" : "-1" (Another optimization option is to start the index without any replicas, and only later adding them, but that really depends on the use case). Then, once bulk indexing is done, the settings can be updated (back to the defaults for example): "refresh_interval" : "1s" And, an optimize should be called: curl -XPOST 'http://localhost:9200/test/_optimize?max_num_segments=5'

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.BlocksReadOnly
member.summary: index.blocks.read_only Set to true to have the index read only, false to allow writes and metadata changes.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.BlocksRead
member.summary: index.blocks.read Set to true to disable read operations against the index.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.BlocksWrite
member.summary: index.blocks.write Set to true to disable write operations against the index.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.BlocksMetadata
member.summary: index.blocks.metadata Set to true to disable metadata operations against the index.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.IndexConcurrency
member.summary: index.index_concurrency Defaults to 8.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.CodecBloomLoad
member.summary: index.codec.bloom.load Whether to load the bloom filter. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.FailOnMergeFailure
member.summary: index.fail_on_merge_failure Default to true.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.TranslogFlushThresholdOps
member.summary: index.translog.flush_threshold_ops When to flush based on operations. http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/index-modules-translog.html

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.TranslogFlushThresholdSize
member.summary: index.translog.flush_threshold_size When to flush based on translog (bytes) size.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.TranslogflushThresholdPeriod
member.summary: index.translog.flush_threshold_period When to flush based on a period of not flushing.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.TranslogDisableFlush
member.summary: index.translog.disable_flush Disables flushing. Note, should be set for a short interval and then enabled.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.CacheFilterMaxSize
member.summary: index.cache.filter.max_size The maximum size of filter cache (per segment in shard). Set to -1 to disable.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.CacheFilterExpire
member.summary: index.cache.filter.expire The expire after access time for filter cache. Set to -1 to disable.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.GatewaySnapshotInterval
member.summary: index.gateway.snapshot_interval The gateway snapshot interval (only applies to shared gateways). Defaults to 10s.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.RoutingAllocationInclude
member.summary: index.routing.allocation.include.* A node matching any rule will be allowed to host shards from the index.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.RoutingAllocationExclude
member.summary: index.routing.allocation.exclude.* A node matching any rule will NOT be allowed to host shards from the index.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.RoutingAllocationRequire
member.summary: index.routing.allocation.require.* Only nodes matching all rules will be allowed to host shards from the index.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.RoutingAllocationEnable
member.summary: index.routing.allocation.enable Enables shard allocation for a specific index. It can be set to: all (default) - Allows shard allocation for all shards. primaries - Allows shard allocation only for primary shards. new_primaries - Allows shard allocation only for primary shards for new indices. none - No shard allocation is allowed.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.RoutingAllocationTotalShardsPerNode
member.summary: index.routing.allocation.total_shards_per_node Controls the total number of shards (replicas and primaries) allowed to be allocated on a single node. Defaults to unbounded (-1).

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.RecoveryInitialShards
member.summary:
index.recovery.initial_shards When using local gateway a particular shard is recovered only if there can be allocated quorum shards in the cluster. It can be set to:
quorum (default) quorum-1 (or half) full full-1. Number values are also supported, e.g. 1.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.TtlDisablePurge
member.summary: index.ttl.disable_purge Disables temporarily the purge of expired docs.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.GcDeletes
member.summary: index.gc_deletes Disables temporarily the purge of expired docs.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.TranslogFsType
member.summary: index.translog.fs.type Either simple or buffered (default).

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.CompoundFormat
member.summary: index.compound_format See index.compound_format in the section called “Index Settingsedit”.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.CompoundOnFlush
member.summary: index.compound_on_flush See `index.compound_on_flush in the section called “Index Settingsedit”.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.IndexUpdateSettings.WarmerEnabled
member.summary: index.warmer.enabled See Warmers. Defaults to true.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.OptimizeParameters.GetOptimizeParameters
member.summary: Returns the set parameters for the optimize Request

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.OptimizeParameters.OnlyExpungeDeletesSet
member.summary: only_expunge_deletes Should the optimize process only expunge segments with deletes in it. In Lucene, a document is not deleted from a segment, just marked as deleted. During a merge process of segments, a new segment is created that does not have those deletes. This flag allows to only merge segments that have deletes. Defaults to false. Note that this won’t override the index.merge.policy.expunge_deletes_allowed threshold.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.OptimizeParameters.Flush
member.summary: flush Should a flush be performed after the optimize. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.OptimizeParameters.WaitForMerge
member.summary: wait_for_merge Should the request wait for the merge to end. Defaults to true. Note, a merge can potentially be a very heavy operation, so it might make sense to run it set to false.

member.name: F:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchCrudReindex`2.ScanAndScrollConfiguration
member.summary: Scan ans scroll settings for the reindex. You should keep this small, otherwise the response request will be too larger. Default is 5 seconds with a size of 500 documents pro shard.

member.summary: Reindex constructor. The class reuires a index and a type for the old index and also the new index. The old index can then be converteds or reindexed to the new index.
member.param: index and index type parameters for the old index
index and index type parameters for the new index

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchCrudReindex`2.SwitchAliasfromOldToNewIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Resets the alias from the old index to the new index. Assumes that a alias is used for the old indeex. This way, reindex can be done live.
member.param: alias string used for the index.

member.summary: This method is used to reindex one index to a new index using a query, and two Functions.

member.name: T:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration class used for the context settings.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.ElasticsearchMappingResolver
member.summary: Mapping resolver used to get set each mapping configuration for a type. A type can only have one mapping pro context.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.SaveChildObjectsAsWellAsParent
member.summary: Saves all child objects as well as the parent if set. The child objects will be saved as nested or as separate documents depending on ProcessChildDocumentsAsSeparateChildIndex

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.ProcessChildDocumentsAsSeparateChildIndex
member.summary: Context will save child objects as separate types in the same index if set. Otherwise child itemas are saved as nested objects.

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.UserDefinedRouting
member.summary: This defines idf you want to define your own routing. You should only do this if you know what you are doing or you have grandchild documents in a parent child grandchild relationship. This makes certain that the grandchildren are defined on the same shard. It also cuses that gets, etc required the routing value of the parent route document...

member.name: T:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMapping
member.summary: Default mapping for your Entity. You can implement this clas to implement your specific mapping if required Everything is lowercase and the index is pluralized

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMapping.MapEntityValues(ElasticsearchCRUD.Model.EntityContextInfo,ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchCrudJsonWriter,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ovveride this if your default mapping needs to be changed. default type is lowercase for properties, indes pluralized and type to lower
member.param: This tells the serializer to create a Json property mapping from the entity and not the document itself

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMapping.GetDocumentType(System.Type)
member.summary: Override this if you require a special type definitoin for your document type.
member.returns: The type used in Elasticsearch for this type

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMapping.GetIndexForType(System.Type)
member.summary: Overide this if you need to define the index for your document. Required if your using a child document type. Default: pluralize the default type
member.returns: The index used in Elasticsearch for this type

member.returns: string, boolean, and null. float, double, byte, short, integer, and long date binary

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.AddUpdateDocument(System.Object,System.Object,ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.RoutingDefinition)
member.summary: Adds a document to the pending changes list. Nor HTTP request is sent with this method. If the save changes is not called, the document is not added or updated in the search engine
member.param: Document to be added or updated

parent id of the document. This is only used if the ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.ProcessChildDocumentsAsSeparateChildIndex property is set to true. The document is then saved with the parent routing. It will also be saved even if the parent does not exist.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteDocument``1(System.Object,ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.RoutingDefinition)
member.summary: Adds a document to the pending changes list to be deletedd. Nor HTTP request is sent with this method. If the save changes is not called, the document is not added or updated in the search engine
member.typeparam: This type is used to get the index and type of the document
member.param: id of the document which will be deleted.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.SaveChangesAndInitMappings
member.summary: Saves all the changes in the pending list of changes, add, update and delete. It also creates mappings and indexes if the child documents are saved as separate index types. ElasticsearchSerializerConfiguration.ProcessChildDocumentsAsSeparateChildIndex= true
member.returns: Returns HTTP response information

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.SaveChanges
member.summary: Saves all the changes in the pending list of changes, add, update and delete. No mappings are created here for child document types.
member.returns: Returns HTTP response information

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.SaveChangesAsync
member.summary: async Saves all the changes in the pending list of changes, add, update and delete. No mappings are created here for child document types.
member.returns: Returns HTTP response information

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.IndexOptimize(System.String,ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.OptimizeParameters)
member.summary: The optimize API allows to optimize one or more indices through an API. The optimize process basically optimizes the index for faster search operations (and relates to the number of segments a Lucene index holds within each shard). The optimize operation allows to reduce the number of segments by merging them.
member.returns: number of successfully optimized

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.IndexOptimizeAsync(System.String,ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextAddDeleteUpdate.IndexModel.OptimizeParameters)
member.summary: Async The optimize API allows to optimize one or more indices through an API. The optimize process basically optimizes the index for faster search operations (and relates to the number of segments a Lucene index holds within each shard). The optimize operation allows to reduce the number of segments by merging them.
member.returns: number of successfully optimized

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.IndexClose(System.String)
member.summary: The open and close index APIs allow to close an index, and later on opening it. A closed index has almost no overhead on the cluster (except for maintaining its metadata), and is blocked for read/write operations. A closed index can be opened which will then go through the normal recovery process.
member.returns: true ids successfuly

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.IndexCloseAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Async The open and close index APIs allow to close an index, and later on opening it. A closed index has almost no overhead on the cluster (except for maintaining its metadata), and is blocked for read/write operations. A closed index can be opened which will then go through the normal recovery process.
member.returns: true ids successfuly

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.IndexOpen(System.String)
member.summary: The open and close index APIs allow to close an index, and later on opening it. A closed index has almost no overhead on the cluster (except for maintaining its metadata), and is blocked for read/write operations. A closed index can be opened which will then go through the normal recovery process.
member.returns: true ids successfuly

member.summary: Async The open and close index APIs allow to close an index, and later on opening it. A closed index has almost no overhead on the cluster (except for maintaining its metadata), and is blocked for read/write operations. A closed index can be opened which will then go through the normal recovery process.
member.returns: true ids successfuly

member.summary: Gets a document by id. Elasticsearch GET API

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.Search``1(System.String,System.String,ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextSearch.ScanAndScrollConfiguration)
member.summary: Search API method to search for anything. any json string which matches the Elasticsearch Search API can be used. Only single index and type search
member.typeparam: Type T used for the index and tpye used in the search
member.param: JSON string which matches the Elasticsearch Search API
If this search is part of a scan and scroll, you can add the scrollId to open the context
member.returns: A collection of documents of type T

members.member:
async Search API method to search for anything. any json string which matches the Elasticsearch Search API can be used. Only single index and type search
Type T used for the index and tpye used in the search JSON string which matches the Elasticsearch Search API /// If this search is part of a scan and scroll, you can add the scrollId to open the context Required scroll configuration A collection of documents of type T in a Task

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.SearchExists``1(System.String)
member.summary: executes a post request to checks if at least one document exists for the search query.
member.typeparam: Type used to define the type and index in elsticsearch
member.returns: true if one document exists for the search query

member.summary: async executes a post request to checks if at least one document exists for the search query.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.SearchCreateScanAndScroll``1(System.String,ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextSearch.ScanAndScrollConfiguration)
member.summary: Creates a new scan and scroll search. Takes the query json content and returns a _scroll_id in the payload for the following searches. If your doing a live reindexing, you should use a timestamp in the json content query.
member.typeparam: index and type formt search scan and scroll
member.param: The scan and scroll configuration, for example scroll in time units
member.returns: Returns the _scroll_id in the Payload property and the total number of hits.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.SearchCreateScanAndScrollAsync``1(System.String,ElasticsearchCRUD.ContextSearch.ScanAndScrollConfiguration)
member.summary: Async Creates a new scan and scroll search. Takes the query json content and returns a _scroll_id in the payload for the following searches. If your doing a live reindexing, you should use a timestamp in the json content query.
member.typeparam: index and type formt search scan and scroll
member.param: The scan and scroll configuration, for example scroll in time units
member.returns: Returns the _scroll_id in the Payload property and the total number of hits.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteIndexAsync``1
member.summary: Delete the whole index if it exists and Elasticsearch allows delete index. Property AllowDeleteForIndex must also be set to true.
member.typeparam: Type used to get the index to delete.
member.returns: Result details in a task

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteIndex``1
member.summary: Delete the whole index if it exists and Elasticsearch allows delete index. Property AllowDeleteForIndex must also be set to true.
member.typeparam: Type used to get the index to delete.
member.returns: Result details in a , true if ok

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteIndexTypeAsync``1
member.summary: Async Delete the whole index type if it exists and Elasticsearch allows delete index. This can be used for deleting child types in an existing index. Property AllowDeleteForIndex must also be set to true.
member.typeparam: Type used to get the index to delete.
member.returns: Result details in a task

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.DeleteIndexType``1
member.summary: Delete the whole index type if it exists and Elasticsearch allows delete index. This can be used for deleting child types in an existing index. Property AllowDeleteForIndex must also be set to true.
member.typeparam: Type used to get the index to delete.
member.returns: Result details in a true if ok

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose used to clean the HttpClient

member.name: P:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchContext.AllowDeleteForIndex
member.summary: This bool needs to be set to true if you want to delete an index. Per default this is false.

member.name: T:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMappingResolver
member.summary: This class is used to add all register all the type definitions and then resolver them when requesting or handling response data from Elasticsearch. If no mapping is defined, the default mapping is used.

member.name: M:ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMappingResolver.AddElasticSearchMappingForEntityType(System.Type,ElasticsearchCRUD.ElasticsearchMapping)
member.summary: You can add custom Type handlers here for specific mapping. Only one mapping can be defined pro type.
